lines.text: I'm told, "Don't talk like you normally talk. Watch how you hold your mouth. You look too sour and crabby. Don't get angry. Don't ask too many questions, or they think you're trying to be smart. And never, never, never laugh or you're an uncaring bitch." Well, I can't cry to order, and I won't be squashed into some dumb act for the public... or for you.
Look, Mr. Barker. I wasn't there. I can only go on the evidence of my own eyes. We're talking about my baby daughter... not some object!
I don't think a lot of people realise how important innocence is to innocent people.

[after being released from prison]
Hello Kahlia. Hello darling. Don't you look lovely - such a pretty dress.
This is Mummy, darling. She's back.
Can you believe it, the rumours are in New Zealand already!
A lie goes 'round the world while truth's still putting its boots on, sweetheart.
I saw you this afternoon. Gone up the rock with a baby in a backpack. Carried a six-pack; I thought you were cracked!
You know Greg, the worst thing for a thirst is alcohol.
Aw, you gotta be jokin' mate, the worst thing for a thirst is sand!
No, you're right, it's exactly the same model as mine.
Have a look at what Webber found under the dash!
